description: Part 5 of Flashcards Set 2 (Policy provisions, group & health insurance basics)

questions.question: An insured covered by life insurance has just died. What will happen if the primary beneficiary had already died before the insured and contingent beneficiary?
options: Proceeds will go to the primary beneficiary's estate
Probate will decide who receives proceeds
Proceeds will go to the contingent beneficiary
Proceeds will go to the insured's estate
questions.explanation: In this situation, the contingent beneficiary will receive the proceeds.

questions.question: N is covered by a Term Life policy and does not make the required premium payment which was due August 1. N dies September 15. What action will the insurer take?
options: Claim will be paid in full
Claim will be decided by an arbitrator
questions.explanation: In this situation, the insurance company will deny the claim, as the policy would have lapsed due to nonpayment by September 15.

questions.question: F needs life insurance that provides coverage for only a limited amount of time with a death benefit that changes regularly according to a schedule. What kind of policy is needed?
questions.explanation: A life insurance policy written for a specified period of time with a death benefit that changes regularly according to a schedule is a decreasing term policy.

questions.question: Q would like to purchase $100,000 of permanent protection on his wife and $50,000 of Term coverage on himself under the same policy. What kind of policy should Q purchase?
options: Whole life policy with other insured rider
Whole life policy with a Guaranteed Insurability option
questions.explanation: In this situation, a whole life policy with an other insured rider would be appropriate.

questions.question: E and F are business partners. Each takes out a $500,000 life insurance policy on the other, naming himself as primary beneficiary. E and F eventually terminate their business, and four months later E dies. Although E was married with three children at the time of death, the primary beneficiary is still F. However, an insurable interest no longer exists. Where will the proceeds from E's life insurance policy be directed to?
questions.explanation: In this situation, the proceeds from E's life insurance policy will go to F. Insurable interest only needs to exist at the time of application.

questions.question: Under what system do a group of doctors and hospitals in a designated area contract with an insurer to provide services at a prearranged cost to the insured?
questions.explanation: Under a Preferred Provider Organization (PPO), a group of doctors and hospitals in a designated area contract with an insurer to provide services at a prearranged cost to the insured.

questions.question: Which of these statements is INCORRECT regarding a Preferred Provider Organization (PPO)?
options: PPO's normally have more providers to chose from as compared to an HMO
Prices are negotiated in advance for PPO providers
In-network PPO providers offer members better coverage of incurred expenses
PPO's are NOT a type of managed care systems
questions.explanation: PPO's ARE considered to be a managed health care system.

questions.question: P is a Major Medical policyowner who is hospitalized as a result of injuries sustained from participating in a carjacking. How will the insurer most likely handle this claim?
options: Claim will be denied and policy terminated
questions.explanation: If a person is injured while committing an illegal act, health insurance will not cover the expense of the injury.

questions.question: A Disability Income policyowner suffers a disability which was due to the same cause as a previous disability. Both disabilities occurred within a five-month period. The insurer may cover the second disability without a new elimination period under the
questions.explanation: The insurer will provide the same benefits without a new elimination period under the Recurrent Disability provision.

questions.question: Which of these actions should a producer take when submitting an insurance application to an insurer?
options: Issue a binding receipt to applicant if no initial premium is submitted
Disclose to the applicant the amount of commissions to be earned on this transaction
Inform insurer of relevant information not included on the application
Arrange for a copy of the Attending Physician Statement (APS) to be sent to the producer
questions.explanation: One of the actions a producer should take when submitting an application is to advise the insurer of any other relevant information not contained in the application.

questions.question: To receive a percentage of the policy face value, an owner of a life policy may sell the policy to a(n)
questions.explanation: To receive a percentage of the policy face value, an owner of a life policy may sell the policy to a viatical settlement provider.

questions.question: Which type of life policy contains a monthly mortality charge as well as self-directed investment choices?
questions.explanation: Variable Universal Life is comprised of monthly mortality charges and self directed investment choices.

questions.question: C is a key employee at ABC Incorporated. If a Key Employee life policy is purchased on her life, which of these statements would be true?
options: ABC is the policyowner, C is the insured, and her husband is the beneficiary
ABC is the policyowner, C is the insured, and ABC is the beneficiary
C is the policyowner and the insured, and ABC is the beneficiary
C is the policyowner, the insured, and the beneficiary
questions.explanation: ABC is the policyowner, C is the insured, and ABC is the beneficiary.

questions.question: P died five years after purchasing a life policy. While investigating the claim, the insurer discovered material misrepresentations made by P during the application process. Which of these actions will the insurer take?
options: Beneficiary will be denied the claim
Beneficiary will be denied the claim and refunded all paid premiums
Beneficiary will be paid the Death Benefit
Beneficiary will be paid a partial Death Benefit
questions.explanation: The incontestable clause prevents the insurer from canceling the contract even for a material misrepresentation.

questions.question: A policy loan is made possible by which of these life insurance policy features?
questions.explanation: The Cash value provision makes a policy loan possible.

questions.question: Which factors are taken into consideration when an insurance company determines the premium rate for a Whole Life policy on an applicant?
questions.explanation: To determine the premium rate on a Whole Life policy, an insurance company will consider the risk classification of the applicant.

questions.question: Which statement is TRUE in regards to a policy loan?
options: Past-due interest payments not paid after 3 months will void the policy
Past-due interest on a policy loan is added to the total debt
Insurance companies can send delinquent interest accounts to a collection agency
Insurance companies can charge an interest rate based on the policyowner's credit report
questions.explanation: Interest on a loan which is not paid when due is added to the total debt.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a characteristic of a Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA)?
options: HRA's can be offered with other health plans
HRA's allow reimbursement for eligible medical expenses
questions.explanation: HRA plans are employer-funded medical reimbursement plans

questions.question: Which of these statements concerning an individual Disability Income policy is TRUE?
options: Age of the insured determines the amount of the benefits
questions.explanation: Disability Income policies typically contain an Elimination period.

questions.question: Periodic health claim payments MUST be made at least
questions.explanation: Under an individual health policy, periodic claim payments must be made at least monthly.
